Description: This auction is for a used 2011 Godin LGX-SA AAA Flamed Maple Cognac Burst Electric Guitar in excellent condition.The guitar has 3 voices: electric, acoustic, and 13 pin synth access. Bought this in 2012 and it immediately became my main guitar. Played this every weekend in church for about 2 years. I’ve used it with a Roland GR-33 and also run 2 cables from the acoustic jack and electric jack at the same time. Probably the most versatile guitar I’ve ever owned, seen, or heard. I’ve been hanging onto this beauty for awhile, but with a change in location and instrumentation needs, she just isn’t seeing the same amount of action anymore. I still own 2 other Godin electric guitars and I truly believe they are the best “unknown guitar” out there. This beast has a mahogany body with a AAA-grade figured maple top. The mahogany neck has an ebony finger board that significantly improves synth tracking as compared to a rosewood fretboard. The custom RMC system provides acoustic guitar sounds from a bridge transducer,while Seymour Duncan custom humbuckers drive the electric tone. Synth access comes courtesy of the 13-pin connector for direct control of Roland GR Series and Axon AX100 guitar synths. Acoustic and electric outputs can be used alone or in tandem to further expand the tonal textures and flexibility. Features:· Mahogany body with a AAA-grade flamed maple top· Mahogany neck with ebony fingerboard for improved synth tracking· Custom RMC system deliver acoustic tone from a bridge transducer· Custom Seymour Duncan humbuckers: SH II Jazz (neck), Custom III (bridge)· 13-pin connector provides synth/computer access for limitless tonal possibilities· Acoustic/Mix and Electric outputs can be used alone or blended· Includes a hard-shell Godin case The guitar is in excellent condition and fully functional. Never transported very far and I haven’t found a nick or scratch on her anywhere though I’m sure there’s probably a small ding here or there. There is some typical fret wear and some minor pitting on the pickup covers. Here’s a link to the pdf file from the Godin site with all the info you could ever want. I’ve put a printed one in the case.http://godinguitars.com/lgxsa.pdf Shipping is a flat $60 via UPS or USPS ground to anywhere in the lower 48 states unless extra shipping charges are paid. I typically ship items on Mondays and Wednesdays. I reserve the right to cancel bids from anyone without feedback, frequent name changes, a history of poor transactions, or anything that makes me uncomfortable.
Title: Godin LGX-SA AAA Flamed Maple Cognac Burst Electric Guitar with HSC - exc cond
